A paper sign reminds you not to sit more than 20 minutes, but it doesn't feel like anyone would rush to get you out of there. I understand why people come here and I understand why others don't. Is it the best apple fritter in the city? I can say there's no apple fritter I would definitively say is better and if you're willing to trek to Old Fashioned Donuts that fritter will be waiting for you with service with a smile.

34.description: I love these donuts and have been coming here for years! I'm so happy they're not conveniently close by because if they were, I'd seriously be in trouble. I love how fresh the donuts are and I've never been unhappy with any of the flavor varieties. Of course you can never go wrong with the classic glazed donut. They also have a fantastic apple fritter donut that's to die for. The one complaint that I do have is that I'm not particularly fond of the customer service. Or should I say lack thereof. I'm huge on customer service and I don't want to get a feeling of intimidation while placing an order. I dislike patronizing businesses when they person taking my order has an attitude. I also feel that there can be multiple people filling orders especially if there is a crowd. It would also be nice if they accepted credit cards but they don't.

16.description: LEGENDARY! There's a lot of trendy Northside doughnut shops that get publicity but, they ALL lack the quality and perfection of a well crafted doughnut. Old Fashioned is the last of the greats. Simple and excellent. None of that flash in the pan stuff. The Apple Fritters are just a work of art. Quality ingredients and down right iconic doughnut greatness.

13.description: Apple fritters are huge, amazing, and fresh.  The other donuts are also excellent.

11.description: The only good thing about this place is the donuts, and they ain't all that great. the  women working the counter are extremely rude, nasty and confrontational. One employee yelled at a customer for giving her too much change...a "setup" she called it, while a bigger woman working the grill gave her friend free food. She did not pay the cashier.The donut shop building  is ugly dirty and decrepit, how they kept a license is beyond me. The counters are unsanitary. The shop is on Michigan avenue where you can't enter without being harassed, threatened or intimidated by beggars and peddlers. I frequented the place for over 20 years. Never again will I set foot in there.

39.description: Have you ever taken a bite into a pillow?  How about a cloud?  Those are the first things that came to mind when I closed my teeth around the freshly baked glazed doughnut from Old Fashioned.  My wife and I were fortunate enough to grab a dozen that had just been made.  They were warm and surprisingly, not too sweet.  We paid 15 bucks for a dozen doughnuts (half glazed, half chocolate), two bowties and a gigantic apple fritter (we don't too much care for fritters, but people raved about them so much we decided to check them out).  On the north side, at Chez Doughnut Gallery, the same order would have set us back $60-70........but of course the doughnuts would have been made with South African all-purpose rice flour and had a strip of organic bacon from free ranging Bulgarian pigs on top. Old Fashioned Donuts does accept credit cards (at the time of this review, the Yelp listing indicates that they do not).  The girls who worked the counter were super friendly and down to Earth, as they cackled back and forth with their regular customers about what was happening in their "Stories" (Soap Operas).  It was a pleasure to do business with them.

37.description: I cannot get over how good the apple fritters are here.   My head feels like it is going to explode when I bite into the fresh fritter.

0.description: Yeah, the neighborhood is BAD.  The fritters are AMAZING - you can taste the yeast risen dough, and the warm cinnamon, and ....drool....Do not come for the ambiance. Come for your fritters, get an extra or two, and fall in love.

38.description: Oh my goodness! My friend knows of my love for Apple Fritters. I always tell him that Chicago does not know what a real apple fritter is. Glazed & Infused = Crap, Dunkin Donuts = Don't get me started... So he and his wife surprised me with one from this place and my mind was blown! This place is legit. The number one question to ask yourself: Is it worth it to risk my life for quite possibly the most delicious apple fritter you will ever have?

51.description: Some of the best donuts I've come across, so far!Yes, it's a hole-in-the-wall little place. Yes, there are somewhat unhappy cashiers some days, and friendly, patient ones other days. And, yes it's in Roseland! They don't get any more fancy than Orange Cream icing, but they do what they do well. And, if you can catch the plain ol' glazed, yeast-raised donuts hot from the fryer...You. Will. Hurt. Yourself! The apple fritters are from Gawd, and should only be consumed in stages. Or shared with others...Let me stop now, or I will soon be making the trip back out to Roseland!

27.description: I love this place . I have been going here for years, and I always order the same thing. I always get three glazed donuts for myself. I have tried their other donuts, and they are good as well.

32.description: I NEVER believe anyone when they say, "oh go there, it's the BEST." Rarely is that ever true, as taste buds are subjective as hell. But this is close. It likely was the best doughnut I've tried in Chicago, for good reason: it's traditional glazed doughnut is very dense (and as such, gooey) and cake-like. I could easily get diabetes here.

54.description: I've been coming here since I was a kid back in the early 80's with my grandmother, I haven't had a donut that compares yet. I still go there and its the same guy making donuts in the front window. Quality is the best no comparison and still cheaper than every other bakery with better quality products. I take a dozen to my job sometimes in the north suburbs by Skokie and everyone always ask where this place is and wants to go there. The expensive places need to take lessons, I've moved from Roseland back in 1990 and still go there a few times each month. THE GREATEST EVER oh yeah and yes they do accept credit cards

48.description: A bit into a donut and thought I was in heaven...yes the donuts are that good. They are melt in your mouth fresh. When I got there they were out of the strawberry, which is understandable since I went on Saturday at 2pm (people line up there at 6am in the morning for donuts on Saturday). So I ended up getting the glaze, chocolate and carmel donuts. I just thank God that I don't live anywhere near them.

44.description: Crazy huge and delicious apple fritters. If you're not from the area, it seems as though you just walked into the World Renowned "Wiener Circle" on the North Side and you BETTER know what YOU want before stepping up to that counter! Ha..Not exactly, they are nice friendly people, ready to make your day with their deliciousness. Wish they weren't out of the Texas Glazed Donut though. Next time, blood sugar level, next time.

24.description: Love these donuts and I'm not a fan of donuts! Very fresh and my favorite are the caramel and strawberry!!

7.description: Yes the donuts are good. The glaze donuts are the best but poor customer service. The women that work there have the worst attitudes. You will lose business with having a sucky attitude.

49.description: Oh my gosh, Oh my gosh, Oh my gosh. My friend and I picked up doughnuts from Old Fashioned yesterday and we just couldn't stop saying Oh my gosh, over & over. Old Fashioned's Donuts are mind blowing.When we drove away from Old Fashioned with our baked goodies in hand, we decided to try a bit just to see how they were. They were hot from the deep frier, insanely soft & fluffy texture and the flavor was absolutely mouth watering. What was supposed to be one bite turned into us devouring an entire Texas glazed donut and a smaller chocolate donut between us. We were on our way to dinner, so that definitely wasn't the original plan. But it was just so good! We could not stop eating. At nearly the exact same moment we both exclaimed the donuts were like crack! We were addicted and had to force our hands to stop grabbing more so we'd actually have something left for breakfast the next morning.Old Fashioned Donuts are the best I've ever had for the light, fluffy, covered in glaze type of donuts. On top of being friggin amazing, their prices are extremely reasonable. A huge Texas sized donut which takes an entire To Go container is just $2.22 and you can get it in either plain glazed or chocolate. We got 2 Texas sized donuts & 3 normal sized donuts for under $8. Wowza! We went to Old Fashioned at about 515pm on a Saturday. They are open from 6 to 6 each day and when we went, we waited in line about 15 minutes. The place was packed and sadly they had a 35 minute wait for Apple Fritters so we passed on those. Something to look forward to the next time we go! The lady who took care of us was very friendly and quick in her service.A very cool little added bonus of Old Fashioned is that the front of the shop is all glass windows and you can see the donuts being made. I've just had my other donuts this morning and I have to say they are definitely better fresh from the deep fryer. But my pro tip is to microwave it for 20 seconds to get it back to as close as you'll get to the warm from the fryer gooey goodness. Finger licking, mouthwatering delicious donuts!

40.description: Holy crap these are good. If you're south of Roosevelt you might as well keep driving and stop through here for some donuts.We were at the counter at 4:30 on a Saturday and hankering for sugar. Is it bad that we ate some of our donuts before we paid for them?! My bf just asked for it straight from the case into his hand and he couldn't stop. I'm lucky I got a bite. It was so good and then we had some more. Then I finished our order and paid. Haha!We've been a few times since and it is awesome. It's too bad it's so far away. I want one now Veruca Salt style... oh and they take credit cards!

53.description: This place is awesome. We went here on our way to the Pullman house walk. My guys dad has been getting donuts here for 50 years, if you can even imagine the neighborhood was a working class safe neighborhood then. I love this place, its literally a step back in time. The storefront is where the donuts are made. They are made by older men who have probably been doing the same routine for the majority of their lives. All of the fluffy goodies are made by hand 100%.I have trouble choosing when it comes to places like this so we got one of all of them, INCLUDING the apple fritters. Whoah, wayyy  too much delicious! The apple fritters were def the stand out of them all. The size of your head, warm, with chunks of cinnamon y apples how can you go wrong.If youre in the hood, stop by you wont be disappointed, YUM!

30.description: AHHHHMAZIING! The best donuts I have ever had hands down! The yeast donuts are SO fresh, pillowy soft and just outstanding. My favorite is the apple fritter, you CANNOT finish one in one sitting, no matter how hungry you are! They are that huge! The first time we came they were out of fritters but we waited the 20 mins for a fresh batch, it was well worth it! These donuts are not the cheapest but they are certainly the best!The neighborhood is definitely sketchy but there were people from all sides of town waiting for these amazing donuts! I will be back again next time I am anywhere near these warm pillows of yeasty goodness!

46.description: This place is the real deal, yo. If you had done a Yelp search a few years ago for donut establishments, you'd be left with Dunkin Donuts and Old Fashioned Donuts. Now there are a bevy of options but I'm here to tell you that there is a reason that Old Fashioned Donuts is still going strong on the far southside after 40 years: their donuts are the bomb. The donuts are not "fancy". You will find no bacon, no ribbons of candied fruit peel or chocolate shavings. But you will find some damn good donuts and one very orgasmic apple fritter...which I'll get to in a moment. The glazed dodos are a thing of beauty, the orange cream is the stuff dreams(icles) are made of and the crullers? My gawd, the crullers. Sadly they were out of the chocolate frosted cake donuts. I thought my friend wasn't going to recover from this heartbreak until....APPLE FRITTER! The apple fritter is as amazing as everyone says it is. It's as huge as everyone says it is. It is beyond words. It can only be described as follows:OH-MY-GAWD. Mmm... *chomp* MMMMohmygod. ohmygod. "I'm so glad we got pecans on this."Mmmm. Oh my...mmmm. Old Fashioned Donuts is totally worth the almost hour drive from the Northside. It's a no frills place with some of the best donuts you'll have. The coffee ain't bad either. Don't be intimidated by the drive or the neighborhood. The counter gal was helpful and warmed up to us and was able to talk my friend down from the ledge upon learing that they were out of the choco donuts.You don't stay for the ambiance, you stay for the donuts...and that's how it should be, shouldn't it?

1.description: I just had THE BEST donut, EVER I had a coworker bring a box of mixed donuts to work.  I've never tasted anything like this before!  Super fresh, crispy... YUM !

55.description: The best apple fritters I have ever had!  Donuts are amazing also! The college kids told us about it and it is worth the drive out of the city! Will be heading there again when we go back!

9.description: Literally just left this place not too long ago, I love donuts, and I read from reviews that this place is a place that you must try! There wasn't a lot of selection but I guess they sold out of a lot of stuff and they had to make them again because there was a lot of people there. But I got 6 chocolate donuts and an apple fritter which was the size of my head! I tasted them the minute I got in the car and wow! These are delicious and they melt in your mouth I seriously can't even handle how good these are! So I would definitely recommend, I'm not sure if I would come back soon because it is a bit of a drive from Hyde Park, but I will definitely come back at some point!

26.description: The BEST donuts ever!  There I said it! Dunkin Donuts, Krispy Kreme, What???!!!  No comparison to these donuts.  I grew up eating these donuts as they were in the neighborhood.  Such a treat.  Family run business.  I miss seeing some of the women in the family who worked there for years.  The best luck you can have is getting their donuts when they are still warm.  Mmmmm....so good, pure heaven.  I am glad to be living back in my old neighborhood so I can have close access to these donuts.  And, for an added treat, get one of their hot sandwiches.  Their polishes are Delicious.  Thank you for all the years you have provided such great food.  You will always have my business!

25.description: The best donut I ever ate. If you are in the area you must stop by here and give it a try. Old fashioned as the name implies. They make them right there for all to see and enjoy. Friendly staff too. The glazed is my absolute favorite. Hands down the best donut ever. The apple fritter is not to be missed either. Huge and delicious.

12.description: AHHHHMAZIING! The best donuts I have ever had hands down! The yeast donuts are SO fresh, pillowy soft and just outstanding. My favorite is the apple fritter, you CANNOT finish one in one sitting, no matter how hungry you are! They are that huge! The first time we came they were out of fritters but we waited the 20 mins for a fresh batch, it was well worth it! These donuts are not the cheapest but they are certainly the best!The neighborhood is definitely sketchy but there were people from all sides of town waiting for these amazing donuts! I will be back again next time I am anywhere near these warm pillows of yeasty goodness!

59.description: Food addiction is a very real thing.  I woke up this morning fiending for Old Fashioned Donuts.  The donuts here are just as addictive as heroin and well worth the one-hour drive from the suburbs.We tried the apple fritter, chocolate frosted cake donut, orange frosted cake donut and the glazed donut.  I am a little embarrassed to admit that my "mmm!" exclamations while eating the fritter may have started to sound like moans.  The chocolate donut really tasted like a slice of cake.  I wanted to exclaim that the fritter and chocolate donut were better than sex.  Well, at least better than bad or mediocre sex, okay?I wasn't as impressed with the glazed donut.  The fritter and cake donuts are really the star of the show here.  I've never had a donut with such a crunch to it on the outside!  We also ordered a coffee & milk.  I was a little taken aback when I was given a small carton of whole milk.  I thought whole milk was for infants.  I gasped when I saw the fat content on the milk package.  Like it was going to make a difference after eating donuts for breakfast, right?One fritter, three donuts, a coffee and milk cost a little over $9.  There are a lot of stools and small tables for seating, or you can take it to go.  They do accept both credit cards and cash.That's not all folks.  On top of the best breakfast ever, you can get a little bit of a show here.  A man they called "the reverend," was a comic presence while waiting in line.  The line was 5-6 people deep constantly.  The rev puffed out his chest and bellowed his thoughts on demanding men and subservient women.  I think he was joking...I think.  Most of the customers in line either chuckled or rolled their eyes.  A few times the employees behind the counter yelled at him to shut up.  The employees are friendly and patient while waiting for customers to pick out their donuts.  While eating, a female customer approached us and asked for money.  I won't ignore panhandlers, so I said "I'm sorry.  I don't have any cash on me."  She lingered a few seconds more, but an employee working behind the counter noticed this and very loudly told the woman to get out and never do that again.  I may be overreaching, but I felt just as safe coming to OFD in Roseland as I would feel walking down the Magnificent Mile or in downtown Naperville.  Why?  Oh, it's because I'm not afraid of black people and I wasn't going to hang out at the park after dark.  I've been coming into contact with too many suburban folks who think the "south side" stops at Bridgeport and anything south of there is like walking through an open shooting range.  A word to white people:  don't be afraid of a place just because you will suddenly be the minority.  By overcoming fear, you will have the world's most perfect donuts.

21.description: The best donuts we have ever tasted.  The croissant donut and French crueler (not sure if I spelled that correctly) were the magnificent. Utterly delicious.  A diamond in the rough.

17.description: The BEST donuts ever!  There I said it! Dunkin Donuts, Krispy Kreme, What???!!!  No comparison to these donuts.  I grew up eating these donuts as they were in the neighborhood.  Such a treat.  Family run business.  I miss seeing some of the women in the family who worked there for years.  The best luck you can have is getting their donuts when they are still warm.  Mmmmm....so good, pure heaven.  I am glad to be living back in my old neighborhood so I can have close access to these donuts.  And, for an added treat, get one of their hot sandwiches.  Their polishes are Delicious.  Thank you for all the years you have provided such great food.  You will always have my business!

10.description: I'm 28 now and I've been going to this place since I was 4, with my mom and dad.  Donuts are fresh, fluffy and hella tasty. I've had everything, literally. My favorite of all time is their cinnamon rolls. I promise they won't disappoint.

5.description: The service is terrible. I went there on March 3 2016 at 6.15 am.therewas a man getting 10 boxes of donuts.there were 3 people  in line and that older women that has been there for year would not help the customer. That is bad business. We alway talk about supporting black business.if I had a business she definitely  wouldn't  be working  there.she does that all the time.

3.description: I made the special trip here from the north side to check out all of the fuss around the donuts and apple fritters, and would unequivocally say the fritters alone were well worth the trip. They are massive, satisfyingly chewy with apples galore, very sweet and crunchy too if you go with the pecans version.  The "regular" donuts are very good too but not worth the special trip, especially since the selection doesn't go much further than those traditionally found at old-school bakeries and donut places. It is a pretty threadbare, no frills place in a run down neighborhood with no frills prices and no frills service, but a very loyal local following (I arrived at 10:30 on a Tuesday, and the line was nearly out the front door), so I hope it's still around for some time to come.

35.description: Oh man. I can't say enough on how tasty the dinner plate sized fritters and donuts are. Quality and freshness are superb!  5* on taste alone.

19.description: I NEVER believe anyone when they say, "oh go there, it's the BEST." Rarely is that ever true, as taste buds are subjective as hell. But this is close. It likely was the best doughnut I've tried in Chicago, for good reason: it's traditional glazed doughnut is very dense (and as such, gooey) and cake-like. I could easily get diabetes here.

28.description: 4.5 stars! This place is amazing.  Must try again...and again...and again.  Some of the donuts are very sweet but overall you can't go wrong.  You'll never eat dunkin donuts ever again.

45.description: Hands down the best donut I've had in my life so far. I recommend the apple fritter!!

33.description: The donuts are extremely good. Better than Krispy creams but if your not here before the afternoon you will have to wait for a while. I really don't understand how they dnt have a lot already made or faster service due to the fact that their glazed donuts are the main reason ppl come here. *shrugs* I guess

43.description: There really are no words to describe the delicious, mouth-watering doughnuts at this established shop. After over 30 years of eating these sweet and savory treats, I still can't choose a favorite but I do love the chocolate or glazed ones best. The apple fritters are so good that I almost shed a tear while eating.

2.description: I'm sorry excuse my language. Best damn donuts I've ever tasted.  They will kill a diet.

18.description: This place is going to be the death of me,,,,simply delicious!!!!! My favorites are the glaze and buttermilk,,,there is nothing better than knowing that the donuts are freshly made every morning,,,,

41.description: This is my all-time, favorite childhood donut shop. In my many travels, have I yet to find another to come close to the deliciousness of their freshly baked glazed donuts and apple fritters. The eclairs are buttery and creamy greatness...I get emotional thinking about the love placed into the fried dough. All the warmth of gramndma's hugs.

52.description: Visited Old fashioned Donuts after reading the DNA Chicago article "ROAD TRIP!"and it was amazing!  The neighborhood is cool in it's own way with a vibrant Roseland community but those glazed donuts were just amazing!    Saw the real MR Donut at work in his storefont window to the world.  You have got to try these real donuts.

50.description: Perfect glazed donut that melts in your mouth. The chocolate donut has a very light crunch to the exterior that is hard to explain combined with the fluffy soft interior but it is the best I've ever had. As every one has said, the Apple fritter is absolutely amazing!!! Not sure what else can be said about this sinfully delicious concoction of heaven on earth with apples.

4.description: I walked out of Old Fashioned Donuts with two apples fritters and a dozen donuts for $15.50 which might buy me 5 or so donuts at the artisan donut shops that seem to be springing up daily across Chicagoland. Pound for pound and dollar for dollar, this is probably the best apple fritter in the city. And yes I did put it on my kitchen scale and yes it weighed in at just under 15 ounces. It hits all my checkboxes for a delicious fritter, huge chunks of apple, crisp glazed exterior, chewy interior. Awesome. I didn't touch any of the other glazed or old fashioned offerings as the fritter alone was the prize of my visit. I have to say, I'm not a Chicago native, so this is not my Chicago, but it's a part of Chicago that's worth getting to know a little more. Seems like everyone working at the store is there all the time, and they know all the friendly faces and customers as they come in. Chatting about what's new, joshing with the kids, it's an atmosphere that's lost a lot nowadays. A paper sign reminds you not to sit more than 20 minutes, but it doesn't feel like anyone would rush to get you out of there. I understand why people come here and I understand why others don't. Is it the best apple fritter in the city? I can say there's no apple fritter I would definitively say is better and if you're willing to trek to Old Fashioned Donuts that fritter will be waiting for you with service with a smile.

6.description: Delicious goodness that is hot and fresh all the time.

22.description: This place is going to be the death of me,,,,simply delicious!!!!! My favorites are the glaze and buttermilk,,,there is nothing better than knowing that the donuts are freshly made every morning,,,,

15.description: Omg these reviews were not kidding. I rarely ever eat donuts and I'm so glad I gave it a try! Amazing. Toasted Coconut donut for $1 even. Can't believe how good it was lol

57.description: Delicious. They may never change the grease that they fry the doughnuts in, but that's part of the charm. I had one glazed doughnut and it was phenomenal. If you don't eat junk food on a regular, you might get a headache (at least I did), so brace yourself.

20.description: Great donuts, been around for decades. The place isn't fancy but the donuts are delish.

36.description: The name explains it all. Old Fashioned Donuts delivers wonderful old fashioned donuts. I went here early in the morning to get a fresh dozen and left with a smile on my face and a wonderful aroma in my car.The only negative is that the drive back into the city is terrible on weekdays. While I am not sure I will ever go back, I will always be willing to pay for someone to drive there and bring them to me!

14.description: Been coming here for the last 25 years, starting with the location on 63rd and Halsted (thanks Grandma).  Always a treat.  I hope the older gentleman making the donuts/fritters knows he is a Chicago treasure :))
Best of the best!  Great creativity and shop is extremely inviting.  Love everything about them!!

20.description: This place has the most beautiful flower arrangements. They are so unique, fresh and colorful! Also has tons of jewlery, tchochkes, candles and candy. Perfect for an easy gift.

3.description: Absolutely fabulous custom arrangement...I wanted to support a neighborhood business and needed a superb trustworthy florist to put a 70th Birthday arrangement together for my mother.  I'm her only daughter, oldest child and out of town.  I have had such rotten luck ordering quality flowers/arrangements from Teleflora and ProFlowers. so, I turned to Yelp for help figuring what did I have to loose.I called Blossom Boys on Friday and gave them a little background...I like Yellow Roses and my Mother likes White Lilies, White Roses and Fragrance.  My mother lives on the East side of Chicago and that is out of Blossom Boys delivery range.I'm like okay....I will have my husband pick them up.  Upon arrival the Florist (don't recall his name) was extremely informative and explained and gave background on the various items in the arrangement.My husband took pictures...But my husband the pictures do not convey the beauty and awe as seeing the arrangement in real life...He also said that with other arrangements he has thought, "those are nice" but with the Blossom Boys' arrange he was like "Wow'ed".The arrangement has lots of buds...once the blossom I'm sure the arrangement will be even more breathtaking.Thank you so much Blossom Boys.  I will be a repeat customer and will definitely refer anyone asking to you.  Once again great job...

1.description: Awesome experience with the Blossom Boys! This year I decided to order my Mother's Day flowers from a florist instead going to Jewel, and I am very glad I did. The super sweet lady that helped me went above and beyond to make sure I was happy with my arrangement.  Everyone in the shop was very nice, and made the effort to say hello. That's the kind of customer service that will keep me coming back.My mom absolutely loved the flowers. Thanks again!

2.description: This is really a superb florist. The flowers in the case are always fresh and long lasting.  The owners are super!  Usually, we just stop by and let the kids pick some flowers from the case for their mom.  For our wedding anniversary, though, I asked the Blossom Boys to recreate my wife's wedding bouquet from an old photo.  The result was stunning (it looked better than the original!) and my wife was blown away.  Highly recommended.

9.description: Great customer service.  Thank you Steve and Ryan for accommodating our needs on short notice. The floral arrangement for my mother in law's funeral was beautiful.

18.description: The Blossom Boys did such a lovely job with our wedding flowers! Their work was amazing, and they were so easy and friendly to work with from the very start. (Not to mention they stepped in at the last minute--about a month before the wedding--when our original florist fell through). I gave them some ideas of what we wanted, and from there they worked their magic! They created all of the centerpieces, decorative arrangements, personal bouquets and boutonnieres. Everything turned out exactly as we imagined, and we received compliments all night on how lovely the flowers were. Best of all, our guests were able to bring the centerpieces home at the end of the evening, and we kept two huge and beautiful curly willow arrangements for ourselves, which look fantastic in our home and will forever be a reminder of our wedding day.I would not hesitate a second to recommend them to anyone, for any job, large or small.

10.description: This place is the best in the city!! I always go here, service is great! Flowers are top notch and always put together with care. Flowers are always fresh and beautifully arranged, it's a plus when you pick up your flowers to smiling faces, pleasant conversation and speedy service!! Keep up the good work!!

4.description: I'm so very sorry  it has taken me several months to write this review. Steve & Ryan were absolutely the most professional, creative, delightful & accommodating designers I have ever worked with. To say that the Centerpiece's, carts and various other floral arrangements that were designed for my Nieces bridal shower were STUNNING is an understatement! Although we met several times and they provided samples prior to the event , seeing everything come together far exceeded my expectations. The customer service, attention to detail and quality of the product are just a few reasons why I would definitely recommend the Blossom Boys.

16.description: I am completely happy to have found this florist. They did a fantastic job of designing my sons boutonnière & his dates coordinating corsage.  They turned out beautifully!

6.description: I was totally overwhelmed with the good service and the quality of the flowers that I ordered. A very kind and helpful woman on the phone seemed to read my mind in making my selection (sympathy flowers). The flowers were beautiful and much bigger than I thought I was getting for the money.  The card was exquisitely written in calligraphy. I can't remember any place that I have gotten better service and such a high quality product. Thanks!

11.description: Steve and Ryan are wonderful.  They welcomed us to their colorful shop and seated us for consultation in their back room.  There they showed us the beautiful orchid centerpiece and harvest- colored bouquets presented in glass containers and vases that realized our vision.  They even added fair trade bells to reflect the silver bells we planned to place on each table.  Ryan called me at each step of the process to confirm our contract and payment schedule.  He and his assistant arrived as planned to our venue and began to distribute and assemble the floral designs.  We quickly created a solution when it turned out I hadn't told Ryan we added two tables.  Steve and Ryan presented our bouquets in dark wicker baskets which were prefect for my nieces to distribute at the event.  The many flowers for our suits, our parents and special guests were elegantly presented in clear boxes with bright tissue that made the donning go smoothly.  The eyes of our guests filled with tears when we brought white bouquets to our mothers and my sister as a part of our ceremony.  The flowers the Blossom Boys created shine in the memory of our wedding day.  We highly recommend them for their creative design and friendly manners.  Albert and Joe

12.description: Amazing! The Blossom Boys did my wedding this weekend and once again proved how amazing they are!  I really had no idea what I wanted. At our initial meeting I showed them pictures of the venue and told them to do whatever they wanted-they're the florist not me. They came with the most beautiful center pieces (people we're arguing about who got to take them home) and bouquets. I would recommend them to anyone. From weddings to just because flowers their is no one better!!

17.description: The Blossom Boys are a true gem in Beverly!  They always have fresh, vibrant and amazing floral arrangements.  From private to corporate events the Blossom boys can make any venue dazzle.  I've seen dozens of weddings with their work and they've never disappointed...even once!Also, stop in and discover the many fair trade items in store!!!  Check out there edibles too....yummy! They are in a class of their own!

5.description: the Blossom Boys did a fabulous job for my son and daughter in laws wedding! The flowers were absolutely beautiful, just what the bride had envisioned. They are very intuitive, seemed to get a sense of what we were thinking of and went from there. They had many creative ideas, and also listened to our ideas. the wedding was at the Morton Arboretum, which is so beautiful, that I was worried that flowers might not stand out. Not true, the BBs flower arrangements aand bouquets blended in, while actually enhancing the environment. It was a a great experience, no stress, worry, set up went very well, flowers fresh.  I have also gone into BBs for flowers on short notice, and they have always delivered a beautiful arrangement.

13.description: The Blossom Boys did our wedding flowers, and were a delight to work with.My idea for flowers was that every girl carry a different color flower, and that they be jewel-toned flowers.  Ideally, I wanted the bouquets to be carnation-based.  Ryan and Steve took my idea and ran with it, and the flowers were stunning.  In fact, my mother loved her corsage so much that she's asked that whenever we buy her flowers, that we get them from the Boys.We met with the Boys a few times before the wedding, and they really were able to take an abstract idea and bring it to life.  We also purchased all of the gifts for people who were doing readings, etc, at their store.  They are absolutely wonderful to work with, and I would recommend them to anyone looking for a fun, reasonably priced florist for their wedding.

7.description: Ryan and Stephen designed the most stunning flowers for my daughter's bridal shower.  We walked into the room and were stopped in our tracks when we saw them.  Everyone at the shower commented about the unusual and beautiful centerpieces.  What wonderful and creative gentlemen!  I love going to their shop because they take their time educating you about the flowers, and how to effectively display them.  They listened to our ideas and brought them to life.  We can't wait to see the wedding flowers.  I highly recommend you stop in and see a wonderful store with two highly professional and reliable owners, who go out of their way to make your day special.  You will not have the same run of the mill centerpieces, but designs of highly creative flowers.

8.description: We used the Blossom Boys for our Wedding this August.Summary: Beautiful work, but difficult shop to work withDetails: My bridemaids bouquets and groomsmen boutineers were BEAUTIFUL. Seriously picture perfect, exactly what I wanted, couldn't have been better. Maybe one of my favorite parts of my wedding.However, my bouquet was all wrong. When we had our first meeting with The Blossom Boys, I brought in 6 pictures of bouquets I liked. 5 of the 6 were of tight, mounded style bouquets, and 1 was a looser garden-style. I explained, I wanted the mounded style, but I included the other picture because I liked it's colors. I said specifically I don't like bouquets with alot of green leafy filler in them. When we went back for our second meeting to hear their proposal, they had me down for a loose garden-style bouquet. I corrected them, and watched him make the change on the paper. Months later, when we made our final payment, I checked AGAIN that they had me down for a mounded-style bouquet; and they did. However, when the flowers showed up on the wedding day; my bouquet was in a loose garden style with all sorts of extra green buds shooting out of it. My dad and one of my bridesmaids spent a few minutes snipping all the green things off, and it helped ALOT but I still didn't really care for the overall look of it.Additionally, the shop could be very difficult to get a hold of at times. They also made a mistake and tried to double charge us the delivery fee. Also, our wedding was two weeks ago, we made the final payment two weeks before that, but TODAY they replied to a month old email asking when we could come by to drop off our last check. So many levels of not organized....Bottom Line: These guys will do amazing work for you, but you need to be prepared to stay on top of them and be CRYSTAL CLEAR with what you want from DAY ONE. Definitely hold onto all your paperwork from them and expect to have to wait a long time for any emails to be returned.

19.description: Extremely nice and helpful people, amazing arrangements...this place is as good as it gets.

0.description: Sheer geniuses! We recently used the Blossom Boys for my bridal shower and wedding and their work was nothing short of perfection. Despite living out of state they met with my mom and wedding planner and facetimed me in for all of our consultations. Given my complete lack of knowledge regarding flower types, the Blossom Boys were able to provide great suggestions and truly brought my overall vision to life.  Their creativity and attention to detail is very impressive.I honestly could not have dreamed of what they were able to deliver.It was an absolute pleasure working with them and with that being said, I would recommend them hands down to anyone with out reservation!

15.description: Excellent customer service, good pricing and a sense of style that cannot be replicated. Who needs a florist or boutique on the north side when you've got the Blossom Boys right here? From soap, to flowers, to cards, to jewelry, this is the place.

0.description: This is a great location for business. Fresh doughnuts and coffee. I had a chocolate cake and a jelly. They were both good. Two doughnuts and a medium coffee is $3.49

12.description: Newly built, so the furniture and decor is nice. They have a lot of stations. I believe 14 manicure stations and 14 chairs, one of the largest I've been to in a while. I went to ZiZi and he was very sweet, took his time with my service and made sure I was taken care of.  Only got my natural nails done, so not quite sure about full sets, but everyone else's nails looked nice too. Will return!

3.description: I pulled up Yelp and found this place on a whim because I needed a quick no-chip manicure after work. Colour Nails was close by and had pretty good reviews, so I walked in at about 3:15 on a Friday afternoon. I told them I needed a soak off and a no-chip and only waited about 10 minutes before I was serviced. My nail tech, Ryan, was very nice and quick! I was in and out in about 45 minutes (including my wait time). Even better, their no-chip polish change is only $20!! I had just had a manicure, so I didn't need all the works, so this is a great price for a new no-chip color. This place is close to work and reasonably priced, so I think I'll be back.

1.description: I've been here before with family and it was great, which is why I chose this place again. I came here with a friend as a girls day out. My nail tech was Tony and my friend had a young pregnant women who's name I don't recall. I couldn't have a conversation with my friend without it seeming like someone wanting to be in my conversation. Then, my tech was so rude and so was my friends tech.  I was seated all the way near the front door and it's cold outside. When told to wash my hands after having my cuticles removed, my tech thought it was okay to wash the bowl while I was washing my hands and  pushed my hands out of the way. both techs would push the hand away to signal that they wanted the other hand rather than say it. A customer came in and asked my tech if he could help her, he replied that he was busy. She replied I know your busy, but can you help me with my question. He told her to find the owner. Who was not around. My friend and I payed $55 for a manicure and pedicure. It was completely overpriced. I was embarrassed to have taken her to this nail salon in my very own neighborhood. I will not be coming here anymore as I don't support establishments that lack proffesionalism within their employees. There's a nail salon literally around my house that doesn't have customers because they are rude and lack professionalism. The same will happen if this establishment don't get it together.

2.description: I have been a faithful customer over the past 1 year. I will not get my nails done anywhere else in Chicago. Helen is my favorite overall in my opinion she does the best nail art. Phat her hubby is amazing with acrylic. Everyone is super friendly. The salon is always packed so go at opening or late if you go on a Saturday.

10.description: First, I will start with the positive and say that it's a nice space...open and bright with newer spa chairs and bowls. Second, my technician, Ivy (I think), was very pleasant! So, the first strike was the price-$25 pedi or $35 for mani-pedi. This, of course, is not terribly out of range. However, I will admit that my normal two places are only $20 and $30 for those services. Second strike was poor range of color choices. As a professional and due to personal choice, I don't want overly bright, ridiculously dark, or sparkly polish. If you like these choices, this is a good place for you. However, some people like more conservative pinks, corals, etc. Fast forward to paying, the thrid strike occurred when Ivy returns with my card with an extra fee ($1) on it! Umm, excuse me, what is this charge for? I spoke with the owner, David, I was informed that "the DMV and other places charge fees for card use." Sir, the DMV also make licenses. Just because they do, doesn't mean that you can! At least post a sign and let me make an informed decision. Grant it, it was a nominal charge, however, it's the principle. Can you imagine how much extra income they generate off of that small charge because no one says anything?! Overall, although Ivy was pleasant, I will not be returning. Why pay $41 when I can get the same service for less?!

13.description: Inconsistent service.... don't pay until you are completely done....I've been into this shop about 10 times...  half the time I have good service the other half poor. ... green does a great job and takes his time.... but there are too many technichians who are just quickly trying to slap on some polish and get you out.    I normally pay before my nails are painted, but if I come back I won't be doing that again.   I get the same thing every time I get my nails done... 3 times now at this shop I've ben asked, and argued with to get what I want.. half glitter half plan polish. I don't care if you think the Polish won't show up. I don't care if you think it'll take to long to dry.. please do what I ask for, and what I pay for.. especially if it  isn't difficult...   I don't go on busy weekends, or when it's crowded so there no reason to rush.

16.description: 1st and last time going. The manicure price in the wall says $12, but I was charged $16 ($1 fee for using c.c)Got a pedicure on Thursday,  the polish chipped on Friday off 3 toes. The manager made me feel like the bad guy by telling me I should have remembered who took care of me...how do he know if I didn't go somewhere else and just coming there to get a free polish change...and the only thing he can do is polish over my 3 chip polished toes with a random color because he couldn't "find" the one I had on (even though I told him the polish name and color number ).

6.description: I went here. The service was very nice and prompt and my nail tech was very helpful. What I didn't like was that she rushed through the UV curing of my no-chip manicure. I got the manicure Friday morning, by Monday I noticed tears in the color, by Tuesday the tears had gotten more pronounced and the gel had begun to left. Today, wednesday, pieces of the manicure gel have fallen off of two fingers. I'm very unhappy with the manicure, but she did pay great attention to my cuticles. Don't go here if you want a worthwhile manicure. By the way, I was the first customer of the day, so there was no need for her to rush.

15.description: I came in and told them that I wanted a pedicure and a no chip manicure. This was the best no chip manicure I have had in Chicago. I enjoyed the pedicure too.

0.description: As soon as I was walked in I was greeted and asked to sign in (I arrived around 10:40 AM so they had only been open for 40 minutes). I was immediately seated for a pedicure and got started. The chairs are big and comfy. The young lady doing my pedicure was great! She worked to make my feet nice and soft. My polish was smooth. I'll be back! *GOOD TIP* arrive early because this place gets packed fast!

5.description: WHAT I'VE BEEN LOOKING FOR This is a very nice new shop.I got a very warm feeling when I walked in the door. But you have to stop by the place to see how much this owner put into this new nail salon. It is beautiful from the Crystal Chandler when you come in the door and the feel so good service chairs. The color changing boarder ceiling. So now the service Again love the service chairs. But I  was able to just set back and enjoy the music while Alice just made me feel special. And yes I loved the quality of her work she does a really good job.(feet, manicure, brows, and brow tint, and my eye lashes )I'm very excited about this place keep me happy and I'll keep coming back This is this owner 2nd shop. And the nail technician Jennifer has been with him for a few years now.So check them out and tell them I  sent you from yelp.

11.description: I like them! My first time here. The service is great and the staff is friendly. Got regular pedi and a no chip manicure. Green was my technician and it was his first day and did a wonderful job! He will be my go to guy for here on out! The decor is wonderful and brand new. The massaging chairs are comfortable. Wish they made them a little longer for us tall folks. Over all it was a good pretty quick day! Total cost was $55 w/ a 20% discount.

8.description: Christine is EVERYTHING. I refuse to go to anyone else for my brows. Im sad im moving back to ny soon. Wth am i gonna do without her. She does it all. I've come in there many times and shes actually managing everyone and she isnt even the manager. Answering the phones and doing nails. Asking others to spread out work to avoid waiting clients and spills. She is awesome

4.description: So this was my second time visiting this shop and I must say I think I have found a nail technician. Christine is quick and good. The prices are like every other shop, you pay for base fill-in and everything else ala carte, cut down, fix nail, etc.. The shop isn't too far from home looking forward to my next visit. Nice selection of colors both no-chip and regular.

14.description: They are one of the best nail salons in the city at both locations that they own they are the truth I love them Ive been coming to them for over four years now and they are really a family oriented business I love them

7.description: The best place to go for consistently good quality. They're like most salons busy on weekends and even then I'm never disappointed and that speaks volumes from me because I'm very indecisive. I have frequented both of their locations and this one is super convenient and close. They have more parking here. As far as services go, I've had manicures, pedicures, brow waxing, Brazilian waxing of which I suggest making an appointment for with Tina because she does the best job in my opinion. Overall this is my home when I need my manicures and pedicures done right.

3.description: Pretty decent hogie... for a former a&p location

1.description: This is one of these reviews that I thought I did a long time ago.I truly hate I don't live in the area anymore so I don't get to go as often.  Shultz has been around for awhile and the young lady who owns it is a beautiful soul...Her son does most if not all the cooking. Its been awhile since I went and got me an order of wings but when I do make it her and her son always seems to know who I am and gives me a big smile every time.When you say Jumbo wings they have some Jumbo wings that are always fried to perfection. I usually order 3 wings when it's just me and I can't eat it all that's how big the wings are. They are cooked to order so be prepared to wait a little but it is well worth it for sure.They do allow you to call in your order as well so that is another option if you are on the go.I would also say that each wing is about a dollar a piece but again when you see them and taste them you won't think that is a bad deal especially if you think about some of the competitors that give you hen wings.I like their mild sauce but I never have them add it to my chicken because it is on the sweet side and I like to be able too dictate how much I add to my chicken. They have run out of chicken a time of two and not because they didn't prepare but because they are so popular. We have gotten a couple of pans for a party and I know we aren't the only ones.You also receive bread with your order but it isn't just some white sliced bread IDK what type of bread it is but it is so good.They also serve some excellent Hogie sandwiches that is very flavorful.There shakes OMG are great made with real ice cream and it maybe its a good thing I don't live over there now because I use to get one at least once a week and instead of losing weight I would be gaining...lol I have no control when it comes to their shakes.If you are in the neighborhood you should give them a try you won't be disappointed.Enjoy!

2.description: This place has some delicious jumbo wings, which they make to order. I would call in your order to cut down some on the wait time. And this is not an establishment that you can eat inside.  I have to say i am glad I don't live closer to this restaurant because I would probably be in here at least a couple times a week. I haven't gotten to try much else that is on their menu because I can't move past the wings, lol. If you are ever in the area, I say go you won't be disappointed.  And the lady that owns it is very friendly and will always let you know what to do to make sure your chicken stays crispy and doesn't get soggy.

0.description: The food at Shultz is wonderful!! Mother is definitely friendly and likes to get things right. I haven't had a bad item off them menu yet. The wings are fresh & cooked to perfection. The Hogey sandwiches are great and meaty as well. It's a place that is a must on your list for South Side of Chicago. I live close by and have to restrict myself on how many visits....lbvs

I went here yesterday about 7:45 p.m. after work and a intense workout.  I was tired.  I needed to get a graduation card & this CVS was nearby.  I will say that I had a bad altercation with the security guard that worked there even BEFORE I entered the store but my rating is due to how the store handled the incident.  I pulled into the parking lot and saw a space that was near the handicapped sign but I saw no handicapped icon on the pavement so wasn't sure if it was or not. I certainly didn't want to park there if it was handicapped.  I saw this gentleman who was outside just looking around so I got his attention.  I wasn't sure whether or not he worked for the store.  I said "Excuse me" several times and then he finally came over to my car.  I simply asked "do you work for the store" and he nastily answered "what's your question!"  I was SHOCKED!  I told him "I just asked a simple yes or no question, no need for you to get nasty.  So nevermind".  He then went back inside the store. To be safe, I parked in another space.  With that treatment, I could have left but I didn't.  I noticed that the person who spoke to me so harshly was wearing a jacket that said "security" on the back.  So, I entered the store, to which the security guard said very friendly "Welcome to CVS!" to which I said "Oh, now that I'm inside the store, you are going to be nice to me??" He lied and said he didn't hear me asking a question to which I replied "you wouldn't of answered me nastily if you didn't hear my question".  I walked away, got my items and headed towards checkout. There were 2 people ringing up merchandise.  They both were extremely friendly.  As I was checking out, the one cashier asked me "Is everything alright, I noticed that you had some words with our security guard."  He actually was ringing up another customer so I was impressed that he was concerned.  I told him what happened and he apologized for the incident.  What I didn't know is that the woman who was ringing up my items was actually the site supervisor.  When she heard what happened, she told me that she would handle the situation and let the appropriate people know.  Because of this, I definitely will be back.  I didn't have to voice my own complaint, they were concerned enough about me as a customer to inquire.  Excellent customer service.  I will be back and hopefully the security guard will have been addressed.

1.description: Came in here for a meeting with a client since it was halfway between our respective locales. They had apparently just cleaned the whole place, which was odd, because rather than a "DANGER WET FLOOR," it sort of reminded me of a swamp, as the floors and all of the surfaces were all equally moist. Not "just-wiped-down" moist, but rather, "cleaned and left very damp by someone who wasn't quite sure how to use a wiping-mechanism."I guess the coffee was okay, but a couple of people during my 35 minutes there I overheard complaining about how they had skimped on ketchup packets. "That's 95th," one gent said. Serious.

0.description: The food was fresh but customer service was poor. They took ten minutes for my order of McNuggets.

1.description: Good barber shop. They have four barbers who all can cut. The price is very reasonable ($15 for everything). I've never seen anyone walk out with a bad haircut. The service is good and they take walk-ins. The wait is never more than an hour and if so, they'll tell you when you can come back. Definitely recommended!

0.description: There's nothing like a barber shop where you can get a great cut and here some great conversation.  I suggest you check it out, especially coming from a New Yorker - Queens, the home of great cuts.

1.description: Ordered delivery a total of three times here.  Never once did they get my order correct.  Most recently I ordered an item which they no longer make and instead of being informed of this over the phone they made a completely different substitution.  I called top confirm my suspicions which yielded a sheepish affirmation.  I wouldn't have minded if it was delicious.  And it didn't taste good.  Below average.  The beef had no flavor, overly battered, and the sauce was weak.I previously ordered a combination meal which was 10% protein and 90% onions.  I did not order onions and meat.  I did not like fishing for meat in a sauce floating onions.  Tasted ok.  Prior to that, years ago, the meal was ok but I cannot recall specifics.While I appreciate the option of delivery, if it is for food I didn't order which doesn't even taste good I will not return here for food again.  My first experience was good.  Second below average. This was terrible and I felt tricked.

2.description: This Chinese food is ok. We never had any problems with it. The shrimp fried rice is good and the lobster with shrimp sauce is ok too. The egg rolls that come with all meals are nasty. They taste like trash. There are also people always loitering outside of the restaurant door and the owners haven't bothered calling the police yet. Thugs and dread head Rasta 's smoke and talk right outside near the doors. If you want to risk getting robbed and if you want a quick bite come here

0.description: Look chinese food for the black man is extremely important to his diet secretly its up there with chicken and watermelon if in the area from 113th to 85th this place has the most consistent food it will always be good (not great but good) if you don't want to try a new place you can bet on them to come through for you consistency is what they do not let's talk about customer service great people when you call they take your order very quickly and respectfully but every now and then they don't pay attention and you end up with with something not spicy or drink that you didn't orderNow LET'S DISCUSS THEIR DELIVERY DRIVER THE REASON WHY I WAS TEMPTED TO SAY FU$% It I had to argue outside to get this dude to walk out side of his car and bring the food to my door like that's not his fu#%#%#$ job now if  this was a one time issue it would be cool but guess what it is not he curses in mandarin I guess he thinks I'm not an educated and don't speak it (surprise it's a smart black guy asshole) and he wonders why I don't tip his goofy ass now when the young guy comes it will be cool but i think he went to school so yall treat him with respect but all I can say is then that middle aged dude comes please try your best to not whoop his ass other than that enjoy
Khalil is the typical liquor store. Liquor is cheap.

3.description: I never had a meal here but I had quite an experience with this place. My sister had her wedding reception here and I thought it was a cool place for her budget and the number of people she invited. We rented the space for $85/hour which was cool for my sister. The owners were outgoing and appeared friendly. However, there were a few things that turned me off. The booths were a little dusty or was chipping away and got on the back of my light colored jeans, leaving black spots for me to dust off. Also, behind the booths were mouse/insect traps. If I were eating at the time and saw that, I would have lost my appetite. Children were also present and could have easily picked those up. They were visible. I would only suggest wiping the booths and hiding the mouse/insect traps. Overall, I had an okay experience and I applaud you guys for maintaining and offering your service to the Roseland community. Would I visit you guys again? I just may  (:

1.description: Amazing customer service. The food was completely delicious. My boyfriend and I normally come up here for breakfast. We get the bacon, waffles w/powdered sugar, and the hashed browns. Pretty much everything you order from here is great.

2.description: Fresh blend of Greenwood, Mississippi home cooked flavor with solid Chicago, Illinois family styled wholesome and healthy for 30 years.  This Soul Food Lite is for the Good Life!

5.description: Sit-down dining in Roseland? What a pleasant surprise! Delicious food, pleasant atmosphere, very accommodating waitstaff. Ms. Wendy rocks! I had the salmon croquettes. Perfectly seasoned, good portions. Tasty! The meal included hashbrowns/rice or grits, eggs and toast or biscuits. The hubby had the daily special - 2 huge pancakes, egg and your choice of meat for less than 5 bucks. You can't beat that. All in all a great experience. We will be returning for dinner soon. They are also BYOB.

6.description: This spot is one of Roseland's well kept secrets. I didn't know that they were open yet and was just driving by and decided to give them a try. The young lady that took my order was so nice. I had the Salmon Croquette special (2 croquettes, 2 eggs, rice or has brown and biscuits or toast). It was DELICIOUS!!  That's alot of food for only $7.95!!!  The only bad thing is CASH ONLY, but that's ok.   I had been craving salmon croquettes for almost a month! I am a breakfast person and to know that they serve breakfast all day is a BLESSING!! Now that I know where to get them, this is going to be a regular thing for me. True the neighborhood isn't that greatest, but once you get inside you honestly forget where you are. It was such a nice, pleasant, friendly and clean atmosphere. Roseland needs more places like this.

7.description: This is my first time going here and I just bought some food to go and I just sampled a lil bit of spaghetti and greens and Omg (oh my goodness) Delish and everyone should go. This is a come up for the Roseland area BIG TIME!

8.description: Good food Pleasant Service. Thanks Wendy!

0.description: Delicious Steaks and Grilled Fish! Breakfast all Day. Have you very private event here also, best hand made turkey burgers in town.  Salmon croquettes. Greens, sweets,Mc n cheeze, amoung outher sides. Come check us out!

4.description: I really forgot what my girl and I had.But i do know it wasn't good.And the waitress had a bad attitude.Will never return.

3.description: I order from the 103rd location. I like the fact you can see the entire kitchen. The food isn't the best but compared to other places in the area its way better. The potstickers are my favorite thing to order

1.description: The Chinese food is average at best .You would think how long they have u waiting , that the food would be really good.Every time I order from them I call in first.Wait 20 mins , get there and wait another 20 to 25 mins .....not worth it!!!

2.description: First and last time I will order from here,food is just nasty ! They made me wait over 1 hour for this nasty greasy food! Waste of time and money garbage!!!

5.description: Awful!  They have two locations and they know have one on 111th.  I ordered dinner for two.  Most of the food I could not even eat....going in the trash.  The fried rice is more sticky with a free green onions thrown in at the end.  The orange chicken...the batter is ok but the chicken taste horrible.  The egg foo young is actually good.  No need to go on.  Want chinese do not stop here.

6.description: Hmm.  I actually like this place. Fresh smoothies, savory shrimp w/lobster sauce, shrimp fried rice loaded with shrimp, and amazing chicken teriyaki strips. We're pleased every time we order.

7.description: i've been to the one on 111th across the street from work, and everytime i eat something from here i hate myself for making the wrong decision. their fried rice used to be decent and big portioned. now they are sold in much smaller boxes and the meat that they put in is very scarce. i ordered the beef fried rice and had a small piece of beef for every 6 spoonfuls of rice. weak. if i'm ever aching for 'bad for you' chinese food, i'll just order 3 chicken wings and a small white rice and call it a day.

0.description: I order from this place all the time. The food is decent compared to other Chinese restaurants in the area. Delivery can't take long at times but I'm fine with that.

4.description: Wow this was terrible a waste of almost $50.00, First i place the order by phone the guy taking the order repeats it back to me everything was correct. Once i arrived to the location on 103rd i was given a completely different order but didn't noticed until i got home, so i call them up and let them know... I go back and they make me wait 30more minutes finally i get my order when i get home the fries on the ribtips/fries combo were so stale and over cooked as well as very tough to chew, the ribtips i couldn't even eat i literally had to feed them to the dog as well as the bread on the combo smelled like it was moldy.... this is sad i blew so much money on food and couldn't even get a decent meal.Kinda dissapointed because i use to frequent this place regularly and usually they're good, but this time they have failed me.

1.description: Wal Mart opened its first express store in the Chatham neighborhood today and it was a very interesting experience because it's a scaled down version of the typical Wal Mart store. It's basically geared towards people getting the things they need such as toiletries for the house and food versus the Wal Mart store where you get anything and everything there. It's also situated in an area where it's needing accessable stores because not everyone owns a car and some are having to do their shopping trips on public transportation. I live about 10 minutes away from this store and it's convenient when I don't feel like shopping elsewhere and dealing with the crowds which is pretty common for Wal Mart. This location also has a pharmacy so you can get your prescriptions filled all while you do your shopping. As I was walking in two women in the parking lot sat around complaining about the store being there when I see it as it gives people a choice of where they want to shop. I shop at multiple stores for things one store may not have that one may have. I do have a problem with how they don't seem to have a policy in place enforce appearance nobody should be working where they have tattoos showing and one employee had teeth missing. As a working professional you would want to look your best when working and tattoos and missing teeth is hoodratish and just plain wrong. I do like how they provide a feedback box where if you want something in particular they will work to get it for you but they do stipulate that not all items may be available due items being seasonal, regulatory, and other restrictions. If you live within walking distance it's helpful because not everyone has cars to drive to Wal Mart and the closest one is in Evergreen Park for the south and southwest side of Chicago. Staff was friendly and working hard to accomodate the flow of customers that came through the doors. It was very organized and Chicago Police was present to ensure that public safety was an utmost priority. The store was clean and well stocked with mostly common items people buy from milk to toilet paper. Parking was not a problem and you could find a spot even though you had to walk a few steps. I will be shopping here again.

0.description: First time encountering a Wal-Mart of this sort. I'm not sure if its common in the city, but  i'm glad there is something like it! The express is fast and convient. It offers a variety of produce, food, snacks, toiletries, and whatnot. What i also like about this express is the fact that its opened pretty late. Its clean and organized. One thing that caught my attention though... is the price! I was a bit shocked to see their prices based on the fact that wal-mart tends to be cheaper. However when you factor in convenience, location, and items offered, I'd definitely be back!

1.description: The owner BJ & his wife Cindy are so u professional! Some of the staff are not friendly and have very nasty attitudes! They are argumentative with the clients & I guess because the location is somewhat in the "hood" they feel like they can LACK professionalism!! Only a few of the employees smile at you. I have put up with the lack of professionalism because the quality of what I was getting done has been good for the PRICE.....that's it!! But enough is enough! I will never return there, I will not recommend anyone to go there and I will tell all of the people I know that go there not to go anymore! Their attitudes would be different if they were in evergreen park, oak lawn or other neighboring suburbs! After they are done being disrespectful they go off & start talking in their native language to one another when everyone speaks English! So You know they are talking about you!

0.description: A small neighborhood nail shop that's well worth it.  I've been coming to this nail shop since 2009.  Michelle, one of the nail techs, and B.J., the owner, are two of the best nail techs I've experienced (I haven't been able to find nor match the quality of service in even some of the most expensive places within the city and out of state).  It's a small and simple nail shop (nothing fancy and no fancy services), however, I routinely come ever two weeks when I'm not traveling.  Also, when Michelle isn't working, ask for her sister.  While all of the techs do an excellent job (all appear to have regulars who come in and request for them by name) she and her sister are the two I always get services from.

3.description: I simply love this place! Their super taco dinner is absolutely delicious!!! Every time I stop there my order is perfect and my food is piping hot!!  This is my favorite fast food neighborhood joynt!!!

1.description: I always order from here. They're food is just so delicious. I love their buffalo wings, cheeseburgers, and so much more. They have good customer service but sometimes they can't deliver to you. Nonetheless it's still a great place for good food

2.description: By fast food standards, tis place is pretty awesome and impressively clean every visit. Have tried the wings, chicken pita, gyros, polish, fried fish and have never been disappointed. Had a polish today based on precious reviews. It was perfect!!! Each bite had the perfect balance of perfectly cooked polish, grilled onions, jalapeño and mustard. May return tonight for another. Lbvs

5.description: when the cafeteria at the hospital is closed on the weekends, this is a nice, very affordable option. the wings are fine, gyros are good, and i am a fan of the footlong polish. they may take a little while to prepare the food, but that's expected since it's made right when you order it. they have daily specials, and if you're in the area this is likely your best choice when you consider quality and price

0.description: Just ate at Jacks, my corn beef was hot, fresh and the customer servivce was great. Will eat there more often.

4.description: This place seems to be wing-focused, and you can order hot and fried wings in huge quantities, but their menu has pretty standard Chicago food features that you'd find at places that do Italian beef, polish sausage, hot dogs, burgers, gyros, etc. Everything is made fresh and you get big portions. Great service with friendly staff. The dining area has unexpectedly comfortable window stools on a bar setup. Everything looks really clean and polished for a "fast food" place (nice granite counters), with a pretty visible and open kitchen area. The gyro sandwiches are HUGE, hot, full of onions, tomato, and really good tzatziki sauce. I can usually get 2 meals out of one sandwich. The polishes are big and smoky, with hot peppers, onions, and mustard. Crispy hot crinkle fries come with sandwiches. Prices are pretty reasonable. Great place.

0.description: First off if you are reading this do not purchase the voucher deal it is a scam!!!! I went to get my hair braided it was my second time going. The first experience was okay, the lady that braided my hair was really fast so I decided to give it another try. Well this particular time I purchased the voucher deal from Yelp for $200.00. I told the lady before she even started braiding my hair that I had it. Needless to say when she was done I told her I had it again, she told me that she was not accepting it and she had informed Yelp to take it down and I should have called her first before purchasing.. Okay so I gave her my card to run and the CC machine was not even plugged up. So I told her I would leave my Driver's License and go to the ATM. She made it seem like I was going to run off and told me the other hair braider would  take me. My fiancé  who was waiting outside, ended up going to the bank. After all of this I go outside to get the money and the lady comes outside with my bag telling me I didn't have to come back in, which left my fiancé and I baffled as to why she felt it necessary to stop braiding someones hair to come outside. Yeah I'm never going back to this shop. Be more professional in the future!  Yelp refunded my money today

3.description: They have a stylist named Mr. Young and he really knows haircare and how to grow hair. I got soo many compliments. You must let him create for you.

1.description: I've had wonderful experiences visiting BKGL. My sons and I patron this cool and relaxed barber shop whenever we need a cut. Bear and Vino (Brian & Alvin) are excellent in managing this classic establishment.

2.description: Just my second visit.  I get a great style by Al Young III, comedy and customer service.  I'll be back.

5.description: Love coming here! Alvin and now Al have taken great care of my coif! I'm a woman who is quite persnickety about her haircut and they put up with my demands in a humorous and loving way! It's a plus that as a woman I am ALWAYS treated with the utmost respect when I'm there. Excellent Barbers!

0.description: This is the only place I get groomed. BKGL is a wonder place! The professional staff the atmosphere and the best grooming in Chicago! This is the only place my son and I come to get cleaned up! I highly recommend BKGL! Brian, Alvin, AY3, Anthony, Dre' and Corey all these gentlemen SLAY!!! Make your appointment TODAY...Get Groomed!!!

4.description: Excellent service. I love getting my haircut there, the staff is amazing, and not to mention the free snacks while waiting to get a haircut. Two thumbs up!!!
